attributes.action: Stop the congestion charging within Derby
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Motorists could have to pay to travel on every major road in Derby under plans sent to the Government.

 
Routes that would be included in a congestion-charging system have been identified by the city council if a bid for cash from Whitehall to carry out road improvements goes ahead.

They are: the outer ring road, including Raynesway, Harvey Road, Osmaston Park Road, Manor Road, Kingsway and Queensway, and the inner ring road, including St Alkmund's Way and the proposed link between Ford Street and Traffic Street. Other key routes in the scheme are the A514 (Osmaston Road, Chellaston Road, Swarkestone Road), A516 (Uttoxeter New Road), A6 (Duffield Road, London Road), A61 (Sir Frank Whittle Way) and the A52 and A38 dual carriageways.

Chris Wynn, cabinet member for planning and transportation, said the council was still considering whether or not to go ahead with the plan
